text: James Forman (January 3, 1946 â€“ January 9, 2022), stage name James Mtume, was an American jazz and R&B; musician, songwriter, record producer, activist and radio personality. He worked with Miles Davis between 1971 and 1975. Mtume's R&B; group, also called Mtume, played the 1983 R&B; hit song "Juicy Fruit". Mtume died on January 9, 2022 at the age of 76.R&B; trailblazer James Mtume reportedly dead at age 76 ==References== Category:1946 births Category:2022 deaths Category:American singer-songwriters Category:American R&B; singers Category:American soul singers Category:American funk singers Category:American jazz singers Category:American hip hop singers Category:American R&B; musicians Category:American soul musicians Category:American funk musicians Category:American jazz musicians Category:American hip hop musicians Category:American radio personalities Category:American record producers Category:American civil rights activists Category:American pianists Category:American keyboardists Category:American drummers Category:American guitarists Category:Singers from Philadelphia Category:Writers from Philadelphia Category:Musicians from Philadelphia Category:Businesspeople from Philadelphia
title: James Mtume
